name: UpdateGroupTypeMetadata
description:
Updates metadata for group types in a project.

Use this tool to update the metadata for group types within a specific project. It should be called when there's a need to partially update this information for better organization and management of project data.

parameters.name: project_identifier
parameters.description: Project ID to access a specific project. Use /api/projects/ to find the ID.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

parameters.name: group_type_identifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the group type to update metadata for. Provide a unique string value that represents the group type within the project.

parameters.name: group_type_index
parameters.description: An integer representing the index of the group type you want to update within the project. It identifies which specific group type's metadata is to be modified.

parameters.name: singular_group_name
parameters.description: The singular name to be used for a specific group type. This is used for clear identification and communication.

parameters.name: group_type_name_plural
parameters.description: The plural name for the group type to be updated. This should reflect the plural form used in the project metadata.

parameters.name: detail_dashboard_id
parameters.description: The integer ID of the detail dashboard associated with the group type.

parameters.name: default_columns
parameters.description: An array of strings representing the default columns for the group type metadata. Each string specifies a column name to be included by default.

parameters.name: group_type_creation_date
parameters.description: The creation date of the group type in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ).

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Datadog API.

parameters.name: project_id
parameters.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.

value_schema.description: Project ID of the project you're trying to access. To find the ID of the project, make a call to /api/projects/.
